sentences: Jens Bjerre Jacobsen  (13 October 1903 – 3 January 1986) was a Danish composer and organist.
Jacobsen was born in Aarhus but grew up in Salling, where his father was a Grundtvigian Community pastor in Rødding-Krejbjerg.
The time spent at the academy gave his earliest songs and choral work a strong element of Thomas Laub and Carl Nielsen.
However, Jacobsen himself never acknowledged this, and claimed that his career as a composer only began after he moved to Paris.
Jacobsen became an organist in Paris.
Under the former's tutelage, Jacobsen made immense progress as a composer, a development that is specially noticeable in his music from the 1930s onwards.
